text: Saint Michael's Lent is a period of fasting observed in the Catholic Church -- from the Feast of the Assumption on August 15 to Michaelmas (the feast of St Michael and All angels) on September 29. The Origin of St. Michael's Lent comes from Franciscan tradition. Saint Francis of Assisi, in the last two years of his life, reportedly began the practice where he would lead monks in a period of fasting. ==See also== * Lent * Saint Martin's Lent ==References== Category:Christian fasting Category:Lent Category:Franciscan spirituality Category:August observances
